arm_group.description: 32 subjects in the study will receive biceps tenodesis as a surgical intervention
32 subjects in the study will receive labral repair as a surgical intervention

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of the study is to determine which of the two alternative surgical interventions
      (biceps tenodesis or labrum repair surgery) is better in the treatment of Type 2 SLAP
      lesions.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating Outcomes After Biceps Tenodesis or Labral Repair for the Treatment of Type 2 Superior Glenoid Labrum Lesions

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  patients with MRI diagnosed SLAP 2 lesion

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  none

keyword: Comparison between two alternative surgical procedures

facility.name: The University of Chicago Medical Center

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Biceps Tenodesis vs Labral Repair for Type 2 SLAP Lesions, A Randomized Controlled Trial

primary_outcome.description: The scale measures pain from 0 to 10 and also includes a questionnaire for assessing the activity of daily living.
primary_outcome.measure: American Shoulder and Elbow Surgeons (ASES) Shoulder Score

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: The questionnaire measures mobility, ability to care for self, ability to perform usual activities, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
